result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mirjana M Petrovich

records.addlTxt: *AMENDED 9/28/2022: If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.*

Defendant Mirjana M Petrovich in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Mirjana M Petrovich.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Ryan. Bond amended. Offer just received. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mirjana M Petrovich in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Mirjana M Petrovich. Victim is also present in court and makes statement. Defendant appears for initial appearance is provided a copy of the criminal complaint advised of charges and penalties. Counsel enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Speedy trial rights reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 9/28/2022: If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.*
BOND TO COVER 22GF816 & 22CM351

DEFENDANT MUST POST $500

Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. No pepper spray. No chemical or electrical spray. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH S.L.G. dob 1-3-1965 or RESIDENCE. NO CONTACT WITH BAYSIDE MOTEL. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Mirjana Petrovich in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney John Ryan for defendant. Total signature bond with cash component set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
